Timer C counter reset/roll-over is used as clock source for the burst mode counter

PossibleValue.Comment: HRTIM instance doesn't handle external synchronization signals (SYNCIN, SYNCOUT)
HRTIM instance acts as a MASTER, i.e. generates external synchronization output (SYNCOUT)
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Master Timer must be enabled and SYNCOUT Pin configured

PossibleValue.Comment: HRTIM instance acts as a SLAVE, i.e. it is synchronized by external sources (SYNCIN)
HRTIM instance acts as a SLAVE and a MASTER i.e. it is synchronized by external sources (SYNCIN) and generates external synchronization output (SYNCOUT)
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Master Timer must be enabled and SYNCOUT Pin configured

RefParameter.Name: SyncInputSource

PossibleValue.Comment: HRTIM is not synchronized and runs in standalone mode
The HRTIM is synchronized with the on-chip timer
A positive pulse on SYNCIN input triggers the HRTIM

RefParameter.Name: SyncInputSource

RefParameter.Comment: Sync Output Source
RefParameter.Name: SyncOutputSource

PossibleValue.Comment: A pulse is sent on the SYNCOUT output (16x fHRTIM clock cycles) upon master timer start event
A pulse is sent on the SYNCOUT output (16x fHRTIM clock cycles) upon master timer compare 1 event
PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Master Timer Compare 1 unit must be configured

PossibleValue.Comment: A pulse is sent on the SYNCOUT output (16x fHRTIM clock cycles) upon timer A start or reset events
